item.title: Qihang Wang
item.description:
Click on the Slides button above to view the built-in slides feature.

Slides can be added in a few ways:

  • Create slides using Wowchemy’s Slides feature and link using slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file
  • Upload an existing slide deck to static/ and link using url_slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file
  • Embed your slides (e.g. Google Slides) or presentation video on this page using shortcodes.

Further event details, including page elements such as image galleries, can be added to the body of this page.

item.title: Machine learning methods for optical communication systems and networks
An optical communicationâ€™s perspective on machine learning and its applications
Comparison of ML and analytical models for lightpaths QoT estimation
Forward transmission based ultra-long distributed vibration sensing with wide frequency response
Optical performance monitoring: a review of current and future technologies
Welcome to ICSNLab, the nice big family
Digital twins of optical networks
item.description:
Digital twins has earned its reputation in manufactures, optical networks could also benefit from its digital twin, which is built upon the historical record, physical model and real-time monitoring data of the optical network in real world. The most important application of digital twins is to perform experiments on this digital replica rather than the real system, which helps reduce the risk and provides opptunity for bolder attempt.

We are establishing framework for digital twins of optical system, novel architectures and efficient algorithms are being expected.

item.title: Domain adaption in optical transmission system
item.description: When deploying network control or prediction algorithms, it is often faced with mild or drastic environmental changes. One kind of uncertainty comes from the change of the external environment itself over time, and the other comes from the topology change of the network itself. We work on developing a domain adaption paradigm that minimizes the impact of environmental changes on algorithm performance.

item.title: Topological photonic crystal applications
item.description: Analogizing the topological phase of matter with substitutes in optics, topological photonics can make the transmission of light highly robust, which can be immune to some defects in the manufacturing process of integrated photonic devices. Two dimensional photonic crystal is the most common platform to realize topological photonic effect. Through some geometric design of topological PhC, some common photonic devices can be realized, which can be applied to communication, sensing, etc.

item.title: Quality of transmission estimation
item.description:
QoT estimation has always been a crucial task for optical communication systems, by predicting the transmission OSNR, BER or any other indicator of quality, the desiners could know whether the link is trustworthy or not in advance, they can take actions such as change the route or give higher system margin.

QoT estimation has been studied for years, however we are still facing some challenges. Modern optical networks are dynamic and running in ultra high speed, the conventional QoT estimation methods remains to be statical and lack of efficiency. Our research in QoT estimation tries to propose novel methods using the state-of-the-art model for addressing such challenges.

item.title: Machine Learning for Future Fiber-Optic Communication Systems
Slides
item.description:
Create slides in Markdown with Wowchemy

Wowchemy | Documentation

Features

  • Efficiently write slides in Markdown
  • 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides
  • Supports speaker notes
  • Mobile friendly slides

Controls

  • Next: Right Arrow or Space
  • Previous: Left Arrow
  • Start: Home
  • Finish: End
  • Overview: Esc
  • Speaker notes: S
  • Fullscreen: F
  • Zoom: Alt + Click
  • PDF Export

Code Highlighting

Inline code: variable

Code block:

porridge = "blueberry"
if porridge == "blueberry":
    print("Eating...")

Math

In-line math: $x + y = z$

Block math:

$$ f\left( x \right) = ;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$

Fragments

Make content appear incrementally

{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}}
{{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}}
{{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}}

Press Space to play!

One Two Three

A fragment can accept two optional parameters:

  • class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS)
  • weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears

Speaker Notes

Add speaker notes to your presentation

{{% speaker_note %}}

- Only the speaker can read these notes
- Press `S` key to view
  {{% /speaker_note %}}

Press the S key to view the speaker notes!

  • Only the speaker can read these notes
  • Press S key to view

Themes

  • black: Black background, white text, blue links (default)
  • white: White background, black text, blue links
  • league: Gray background, white text, blue links
  • beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links
  • sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links
  • night: Black background, thick white text, orange links
  • serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links
  • simple: White background, black text, blue links
  • solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links

Custom Slide

Customize the slide style and background

{{< slide background-image="/media/boards.jpg" >}}
{{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}}
{{< slide class="my-style" >}}

Custom CSS Example

Let’s make headers navy colored.

Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:

.reveal section h1,
.reveal section h2,
.reveal section h3 {
  color: navy;
}

Questions?

Ask

Documentation
